result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert C Ballogh was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS Eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Programs, AFTER one year of initial confinement. Sentence credit of 61 days were granted.
AMENDED 03-14-2016:  Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.  Defendant IS NOT eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

superMiscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to costs, paid in full. Balance refunded to poster.

Cases 15CF758 and 15CM958 were dismissed and read in. No Contact with any of the victims listed in the criminal complaint; Eric V., Heather H., Bethann B. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

supervisions.notes: 01/14/16 PER DOC REQUEST, EXT. SUPERVISION AMENDED TO 2 YEARS.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert C Ballogh

Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.

records.addlTxt: From DOC dated 2/29/16 requesting amendment to JOC.
From DOC requesting amendment of JOC dated 12/10/15.

Defendant Robert C Ballogh in court, in custody, with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.   David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

IMPOSED SENTENCE of: 

5 YEARS 6 MONTHS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 61 days)
  -  2 YEARS 6 MONTHS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  3 YEARS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION;

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
*Any any all conditions deemed appropriate by agent.
*No contact with:  any victim listed in the criminal complaint, Eric V. Heather H. and Bethann B.
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.

COURT COSTS:  $268.00 (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision);

DNA SURCHARGE:  $250.00 (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision);

Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program. (after serving one year of initial confinement)
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program. (after serving one year of initial confinement)

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
